author: Mikevdp
post_text: March 16, 2017 at 3:41 PM#1Is there a way to disable tracking using a macro?thanks in advance.Mike-

posts.author: Mikevdp
posts.post_text: March 16, 2017 at 3:41 PM#1Is there a way to disable tracking using a macro?thanks in advance.Mike-

posts.author: jfguedes
posts.post_text: March 22, 2017 at 1:05 PM#3Hi,I'm trying to assign by macro all the options for some special executors we use. I managed to change everything except for: "Stepped Rate", "Input Filter" and "Playback Filter".Is there any way to do this by command line?Thank you in advance,J

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: March 22, 2017 at 9:44 PM#4Looks like "Stepped Rate" isn't assignable via syntax, as far as I can tell.For Input/Playback Filters, Filters and Worlds are their own objects, which can be assigned to Sequences (as input filters) or Executors (as playback filters):Assign Filter x At Sequ y (Input Filter)Assign World a At Exec b.c (Playback Filter)

title: Disable tracking using macro
